# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.

reasoning:
**Analysis: Ante 8, Standard Pack Optimization**

Okay, Ante 8, round 21. Time to really maximize this score. Currently, I have $82 and am looking at a Standard Pack. The goal is to maximize my score to beat Ante 8.

My Joker setup is pretty interesting: Zany Joker (Common, but offers +1 slot and is 3 of a kind mult), Bootstraps, Four Fingers, To the Moon (+1 slot), Seltzer, Vampire, Baseball Card, and Hallucination (+1 slot). I also have "The Tower," a Stone card enhancement as a consumable. I also have a collection of Vouchers that are: Liquidation, Palette, Clearance Sale, Paint Brush, Magic Trick, and Hieroglyph.

With Hallucination active, I know the next round may involve a Tarot card. I see my Vampire currently sitting at X3.7 mult. Baseball Card is going to give me a big boost because I'm running five Uncommon Jokers currently.

The Standard Pack gives me three choices: Ace of Hearts, 5 of Spades, and 3 of Diamonds. The Ace of Hearts intrigues me as it says it gives $3 when played. This would suggest it's a Gold Card or has a Gold Seal. This is perfect for Vampire, and I want to see if it's enhanced. I'm going with the Ace because the money or the potential enhancement for Vampire is too good to pass up.

I'm in the pack selection stage (`STANDARD_PACK`). I've got to either pick a card or skip. I'm choosing the Ace of Hearts at position 1.

After the pack, I'll be back in the SHOP. I still want to buy the Marble Joker (Uncommon).

Let's do the math on the Marble Joker. Right now, I have 8 slots from 5 Base and 3 from negative Jokers. If I sell Zany, that's only 7 slots and 7 Jokers. Then buying the Marble Joker would give me back to 8, and increase my mult. Let's see... Baseball Card gives me 1.5x Mult per uncommon Joker. Currently, that's 5 Uncommons (Bootstraps, Four Fingers, To the Moon, Seltzer, Vampire). So, 1.5^5 = 7.59x. Now, if I buy Marble, I will get 6 Uncommons and a boost to 1.5^6 = 11.39x. That is a significant upgrade.

I also have "The Tower" (Stone card). I can't use it now, but I could get a nice boost by feeding Vampire an enhanced card. "The Tower" needs a target, which I don't have here. I should be able to use that in a later round. I am currently in a booster pack selection screen (`STANDARD_PACK`).

The Ace of Hearts is +11 chips and $3. Taking the Ace is best.

So, I'm going to `select 1`.

The command is correct; I am in a Standard Pack. The prompt says "select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1>...". This is a Standard Pack, so no hand cards are needed.
Let's just take the Ace and keep going.
